result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter D. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:00 am case called. Defendant Peter D. Peterson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. State will amend Count 1 to Misd. Possession of THC in violation of 961.41(3g)(e).   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts amendment of Count 1 as requested by the State. Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 & No Contest to Count 2. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1-30 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days served. Sentence to begin no later than January 15, 2015. COUNT 2-30 days WCJ, concurrent to Count 1. ON BOTH COUNTS-Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 2, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 1:24 pm case called. Defendant Peter D. Peterson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the time limits to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Initial appearance on November 4, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
from Atty Kryshak requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
Initial appearance on October 8, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:16 p.m. Defendant Peter D. Peterson in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not wish to have counsel at this time. The court will proceed with the understanding that if the defendant wishes to have an attorney he will retain one. ADA Anderson requesting $3000 Sig Bond. No objection by DE. Court orders $3000 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
